top_comments.comment: hmm Maby Mark ZukkenBorg and his Android inner core would face this book of the doom? Sunny bless to all ;D

If there was a real problem, we would simply build an orbital sunshade instead of following this braindead global CO2-reduction agenda. comments_since_last_sample.body: Paint every structural engineering feats white. My cat is white so something tells me he knew in advance what is to come. He has sort of sped up his own evolutionary process.
hmm Maby Mark ZukkenBorg and his Android inner core would face this book of the doom? Sunny bless to all ;D

Building seawalls just push the water to other areas. So big cities with a lot of wealth, that are in low lying areas build a massive seawall, then all the water that will have flooded that area has to go somewhere. It will go to other poorer cities or rural farmlands, that don't have money to build a city wall. Those people will face even more severe flooding. 

It's too late to stop global warming. We need to find ways to adapt. Even if we stop all fossil fuels today. The planet will still probably warm to 3C or warmer.

When was the last time the media referred to "man made climate change theory"? The IPCC has not issued a consensus that all "climate change" is man made or that there is evidence of causation through "carbon dioxide ppm" compared to correlation because this cannot be proven. Temperature has been at least 2 degrees higher than today only a few thousand years ago...no cars, factories, coal power stations...just the Malinkovitch cycles. Stop believing the world is full of constants because its actually full of variables and this propaganda relies on us believing and not questioning whilst people like Al Gore make huge sums of money from the green con. There's 45 times more carbon in the ocean and as the sun heats it more is released to the atmosphere, when the sun is cooler then more is absorbed by the ocean which is why there is correlation with ice core data temp and carbon dioxide ppm and not causation.

If there was a real problem, we would simply build an orbital sunshade instead of following this braindead global CO2-reduction agenda.
